intro: Sarcocephalus pacificus, commonly known as the Pacific sarcocarp, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it often grows in coastal or disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
